definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: To hit(a ball) into the air just beyond the infield.
sentences.chinese: 棒球場分爲內場和外場。

sentences.english: Four hours on the tennis court fagged me out.
sentences.chinese: 在網球場上的四個小時令我精疲力盡語源。

sentences.english: Before I could answer, she had turned around and started back out onto the field.
sentences.chinese: 我還未來得及回話，她已經轉身向足球場上走去了。

sentences.english: I have no doubts whatsoever on the line-up I'll field at the Stadio Franchi.
sentences.chinese: 對於誰會首發出現在法蘭齊球場上，我沒有疑問。

sentences.english: He visits public-houses and billiards- saloons.
A golf course is nothing but a poolroom moved outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 不，高爾夫球場不過是一個會動的戶外臺。

sentences.english: D- Never, I did not visit any ball game last year.
sentences.chinese: 我過去一年沒有到球場觀賞比賽。

sentences.english: She bowled the ball smoothly down the lane.
sentences.chinese: 她很順當地把球投入地滾球場的球道。

sentences.english: He whiffed 10 Mets in a game last June 17 at Yankee Stadium.
sentences.chinese: 去年他在洋基球場上三振掉了10顆梅子。

sentences.english: I have so many great memories from my time at Highbury and Emirates Stadium.
sentences.chinese: 我在海布里和埃米爾球場都留下了難忘的回憶。

sentences.english: The uniform of green speed on the Willow golf course was worse in Spring.
sentences.chinese: 高爾夫球場果嶺球速春季比夏季和秋季較慢。

sentences.english: I had an early dinner to play tennis afterward.
sentences.chinese: 晚上爲了打球，早早的吃了飯就趕去球場。

sentences.english: Visually we have also had to adapt to a different pitch dimension.
sentences.chinese: 從視覺上我們也要適應球場的不同尺寸。

sentences.english: They twice came from a goal down to beat Bolton 3-2 at Goodison Park.
sentences.chinese: 在葛迪遜公園球場兩度落後下以三比二反勝保頓。

sentences.english: Lucas Levia would love to play at Wembley for Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 盧卡斯表示，他願意爲紅軍在溫布利球場比賽。

sentences.english: There is a football match on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 足球比賽時，運動員似在足球場上混戰。
